(c).Initially, large amount of hydrocarbons were detected which were declined over the irradiation time and trends were consists in all photo-catalysts.Additionally, it could be seen that hydrocarbons production rate is higher in larger Agloading levels and the results are consistent with the CH 4 production.However, the decrease in yield of hydrocarbons over the irradiation time was possibly due to their oxidation in the presence of O 2 .The hydrocarbons were not observed in the pure TiO 2 catalyst,

TiO 2 and Ag-modified TiO 2 photo-catalysts with various amounts of Ag-loading.All photo-catalysts tested could reduce CO 2 for dynamic CO evolution as the main product under UV-light irradiation.With the Ag-loading, the selectivity towards CO formation approached to 99.8, implying that RWGS reaction preceded efficiently over Ag-loaded TiO 2 catalysts.Similar observations have been reported during CO 2 reduction to CO over Ag-loaded Ga 2 O 3 catalyst 26.The summary of yield rates and selectivity of CO 2

2 48.Therefore, addition of Ag into TiO 2 catalyst would be more capable to reduce charges recombination rate to enhance TiO 2 photo-activity for CO 2 reduction applications. The TiO 2 and AgTiO 2 samples were analysed for the reduction of CO 2 to CO in the presence of H 2 as a reducing agent under UV light irradiation in a continuous flow cell type and monolith photo-reactor.The blank tests were conducted to confirm all the products were originated from CO 2 reduction only. than the cell type reactor under the same operating conditions.This enactment was evidently due to the efficient light harvesting with larger illuminated surface area inside monolith microchannels and efficient charges separation in the presence of Ag-metal.The reusability of AgTiO 2 NPs loaded over the monolithic support showed favorable recycling capability than the catalyst dispersed in a cell reactor.A possible reaction mechanism for this observation has been discussed in detail.

The performance of Ag-loaded TiO 2 nano-catalyst was further investigated using cell type and monolith photoreactors operating in a continuous mode of operation at feed flow rate 20 mL min A1 , CO 2 H 2 feed ratio 1.0 and operating temperature 100 C.
